title: How do you deal with toxic players?
body:
***Mid laner misses 5 minions***
{{champion:57}} : nice last hitting how did you even get to silver lmao

***Jungler last hits blue buff by accident***
{{champion:131}} :  ggwp noob jungler
{{champion:57}} : stfu you lost lane
 
** *Jungler dies to enemy TF while ganking top*
**
{{champion:131}} : feed my lane more pls. go back to bots



This would go on for 20 minutes until eventually we lose the game over 1 blue buff and a few minions.
Need help with this one. Currently in my S4 promos.

replies.body: heres what you do ... /mute all... and all your problems are solved. i do this every game coz every one is a potentiol ass hole

As soon as the conflict starts, try and dissipate it, crack a joke, I literally google jokes to tell if the team is becoming salty.
Simply just say, "Hey, let's have a clean game, play to the best of your abilities, and please don't flame! We're all humans behind our masks". 
If the enemy is flaming at your team, encourage them to not reply, people will typically stop flaming if you don't reply, because they believe you ignored them (that's the man thing to do). 
Also, if the enemy is flaming, or laughing at or talking smack to a teamplayer, 5-man gank him at every opportunity, and give the kills to the laner, and he'll feel much better. 
Seriously though, encourage people not to reply to enemy remarks, just destroy them in-game and watch their sentences become more annoyed because they are spending so much time dead ;)

I've been using Sky's DST (d*ck sucking theory) and it seems to work very well. I found that making people feel good about themselves can calm them down and actually make them play better.

Example:
_gets healed randomly at a teamfight_ _as teammate Soraka manages to land an E_
[All] Report every0ne (Karthus): **This Soraka is a f*cking god **

5 seconds after... he finally stops complaining about our team not having AP against a Nasus.

So far I've come across two types of toxic players:
1. Those who are just stressed with a bad situation and end up lashing out. I've responded politely to these people, and they apologize and the match goes on happily.
2. Jerks (unfortunately more common than the first type). Basically just ignore and report, not much else you can do.

Nothing, absolutely fucking nothing can be done, trust me.

I spent a good 20 minutes in my last promo game trying hard, very hard to get Fiora out of the top lane, she spent 40 minutes either in the lane, getting to the lane, or killing minions in our base that were stopping her going to lane. That and trying to rally my team to group up for once, at least. What do I get, reported and abused.

Game after game it is not just what they say, you can mute them before it starts, but it is what they do that matters. A player with a shit attitude won't even help the team. You miss a gank, a skill shot, get a KS by accident. They won't just hate you, they won't help you and that is that and nothing you can do about that.

A toxic situation that involves other players and not you can be very hard to deal with. One thing I would suggest is to ignore them and focus solely on what you're doing and encourage your other teammates that aren't involved to do the same. That way at least 3 of you will be focused on the game and not being distracted by your inconsiderate teammates. It's an unfortunate situation but it's almost impossible to deal with if it's not directly linked to you.

Best of luck!

Regards,
EuVee [@euveelol](http://www.twitter.com/euveelol)
